communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails sent to/from/between MDHHS Bureau of Legal Affairs representative Donald Bierer (BiererD@michigan.gov) and any of the following individuals on Monday, June 22, 2020:
a) Lynn Sutfin (SutfinL1@michigan.gov)
b) Bob Wheaton (WheatonB@michigan.gov)
c) Elizabeth Hertel (HertelE@michigan.gov)

2. All emails sent to/from/between MDHHS Public Information Officer Bob Wheaton (WheatonB@michigan.gov) and any of the following individuals on Sun, Aug 2, 2020:
a) Lynn Sutfin (SutfinL1@michigan.gov)
b) Darice Darling (DarlingD1@michigan.gov)
c) Rey Bouknight (BouknightR@michigan.gov)
d) Elizabeth Hertel (HertelE@michigan.gov)
e) Donald Bierer (BiererD@michigan.gov)

Please make sure to include any attachments to those emails.

When providing the requested records, please specifically certify that no other responsive documents related to this request exist.

Disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government during a historic crisis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Because the requested records are limited to specific individuals on two specific dates (and may have already been provided to earlier FOIA requesters), it is reasonable to assume that MDHHS's search will be quick and there will be no fees associated with this request due to the ease of locating the requesting documents. In the event that there are fees, however, I am willing to pay up to $25 for the requested information. If the fee for this request exceeds that amount, please notify me for permission prior to initiating work on the request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Please send all documents related to this request to this email address only.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Erin Marie Miller

title: Untitled (Department of Justice, Office of the Inspector General)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

My husband was overly sentenced 35 years to life for (1) nonviolent crime of residential burglary he is currently serving his 25 th year

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tammary Kay  Townsend

title: Grant Proposals For California Intragency on Homelessness

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails sent to the email address calichgrants@bcsh.ca.gov with subject line "ERF"

All emails sent to the email address calichgrants@bcsh.ca.gov with subject line: "ERF-2-R"

All Encampment Resolution Fund grants issued by the agency to date.

All encampment resolutions fund grant proposals in the first and second round of the encampment resolution fund.

Within those emails include copies of the proposals in pdf format for Encampment Resolution Fund 2nd Round "ERF-2-R" and "ERF"

These proposals should include all on those emails attachments, such as the standardized budget and letters of support from partners Encampment Resolution Fund 2nd Round. If attachments such as letters of support are in separate emails, then provide that as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson
